diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Permanent Neonatal Diabetes Mellitus (PNDM) due to KCNJ11 mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of PNDM was made based on the identification of a novel in-frame deletion (residues 28-32) in the KCNJ11 gene, which resulted in reduced ATP inhibition and increased K_ATP currents, correlating with the patient's hyperglycemia. The patient was stable on sulfonylurea therapy, confirming the diabetes diagnosis linked to the mutation.
